snippet: Many of the people touched by the wildfires raging across California are firefighters, and many had been battling other wildfires when the flames arrived at their own towns.
abstract: At least eight of 585 homes destroyed by Valley Fire in Middletown, Calif, belong to firefighters, many of whom have lost other property or sustained property damage even as they were fighting fires elsewhere; California officials report 30 percent of fire has been contained.
lead_paragraph: Many of the people touched by the wildfires raging across California are firefighters, and many had been battling other wildfires when the flames arrived at their own towns.

headline.main: Protecting Homes Elsewhere, California Firefighters Find Their Own Burned Down
headline.print_headline: Shielding Others’ Homes; Finding Theirs in Ashes
